lines.text:
[blocking Carter's path]
Listen, I don't like it when some tough nut comes pushin' his way in and out of my house in the middle of the night! Bloody well tell me who sent you!
You're a big man, but you're in bad shape. With me it's a full time job. Now behave yourself.
[Brumby takes a swing at Carter, who grabs his hand, punches him, and then slaps him in the face for good measure]

[as he's leaving]
Goodnight, Mrs. Brumby.
You know, I'd almost forgotten what your eyes looked like. Still the same. Pissholes in the snow.
A pint of bitter
[snaps fingers as bartender walks away]
...in a thin glass!
So, what're you doing then? On your holidays?
No, I'm visiting relatives.
Oh, that's nice.
It would be... if they were still living.
[Harry, who's playing poker, is disturbed by Carter's presence in the room]
Thought you were going soon.
Soon. When you've lost your money. Won't take long.
Clever sod, aren't you?
Only comparatively.

[naked, pointing a shotgun]
Out!
Come on Jack, put it away. You know you're not going to use it.
The gun he means!
What are you going to do?
I'm going to sit in the car and whistle "Rule Britannia".
[Carter offers to give Keith some money after the latter was beaten up by Carter's enemies and is lying down in bed with his face badly bruised]
Stuff it! My girlfriend is coming from Liverpool tonight! Nice surprise, isn't it?

[throwing him the money]
Here, go get yourself a course in karate.
Goodbye Eric.
Frank wasn't like that. I'm the villain in the family, remember?
You couldn't run an egg and spoon race Eric.

[to Albert]
Do you want to be dead Albert?
For Christ's sake, Jack!
You knew what I'd do, didn't you Albert?
I didn't kill him!

[stabs Albert]
I KNOW YOU DIDN'T KILL HIM! I KNOW!

[to Margaret]
I've come for you, Margaret.

[to Margaret]
Take your clothes off.
Don't let us interrupt you.
Now...

[to a naked Jack who is pointing a gun]
Jack, don't you think you ought to get dressed first.
I'm off tomorrow, so I don't suppose I'll be seeing you again.

[Pulls out some large banknotes, giving some to Doreen]
Here. Go and get your hair done.
Thanks!
Be good... And don't trust boys.

[Pointing to a small wooden box that contains Frank's cremated remains]
That was left for you this evening... What is it?
My brother Frank.
Is he staying the night?

[not amused]
Funny.
What's that gun doing in your room? Suppose I phone the police, told them there's a bloke in my hotel... who's planning to shoot somebody?
You wouldn't do that.
How do you know I wouldn't?
'Cause I know you wear purple underwear.
What's that supposed to mean?
Think about it.

[Brumby has suddenly disappeared from his meeting with the architects at the car park building]
It's very rude to disappear like that. Where can he possibly be?

[Sounds of police cars converging on the car park can be heard below]
I have an awful feeling we're not going to get our fees on this job.
Good God!
Is he?
[Anna is having phone sex with Carter when her husband enters the room]
What's the matter? You got gut trouble or something?
No, darling. Just doing my exercises.
[in the phone]
Listen, Janet, Gerald's just walked in. I must ring off.
